reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Strengthening the Regional Network of Rural Tourism Enterprises. Strengthenin g the Regional Network of Rural Tourism Enterprises. N/A

description.narrative: Voces por la Naturaleza in Mexico. SuMar will increase the collective capacity of 10 local community-based enterprises to advocate for, design, and implement community-managed tourism initiatives in the Gulf of California of Mexico. SuMar will offer training, technical assistance, small grants as seed capital and exchanges to develop quality and viable local initiatives. It will document experiences and develop a network of small community- owned tourism enterprises that support species and habitat conservation, the Alianza Regional de Empresas Comunitarias de Turismo (ARECOT), to share experiences, generate greater regional impact and influence existing state and national government-sponsored tourism programs. At least 292 members of the 10 groups will benefit directly from project activities and more than 600 residents will benefit indirectly.. Voces por la Naturaleza in Mexico, $252,937 over two years; counterpart committed, $279,559 SuMar will increase the collective capacity of 10 local community-based enterprises to advocate for, design, and implement community-managed tourism initiatives in the Gulf of California of Mexico. SuMar will offer training, technical assistance, small grants as seed capital and exchanges to develop quality and viable local initiatives. It will document experiences and develop a network of small community- owned tourism enterprises that support species and habitat conservation, the Alianza Regional de Empresas Comunitarias de Turismo (ARECOT), to share experiences, generate greater regional impact and influence existing state and national government-sponsored tourism programs. At least 292 members of the 10 groups will benefit directly from project activities and more than 600 residents will benefit indirectly. 1. Voces por la Naturaleza in Mexico (SuMar) will increase the collective capacity of 10 local community-based enterprises to advocate for, design, and implement community-managed tourism initiatives in the Gulf of California of Mexico. SuMar will offer training, technical assistance, small grants as seed capital and exchanges to develop quality and viable local initiatives. It will document experiences and develop a network of small community- owned tourism enterprises that support species and habitat conservation, the Alianza Regional de Empresas Comunitarias de Turismo (ARECOT), to share experiences, generate greater regional impact and influence existing state and national government-sponsored tourism programs. At least 292 members of the 10 groups will benefit directly from project activities and more than 600 residents will benefit indirectly.. SuMar will offer training, technical assistance, small grants as seed capital and exchanges to develop quality and viable local initiatives. It will document experiences and develop a network of small community-owned tourism enterprises that support species and habitat conservation, the Alianza Regional de Empresas Comunitarias de Turismo (ARECOT), to share experiences, generate greater regional impact and influence existing state and national government- sponsored tourism programs. At least 292 members of the 10 groups will benefit directly from project activities and more than 600 residents will benefit indirectly.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1331 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 1200 NorthÂ Washington, DC 20004

description.narrative: In FY 2017, the United States will partner with Mexico to consolidate and institutionalize progress made as a result of ongoing bilateral cooperation, particularly through the Merida Initiative. By weakening transnational criminal organizations (TCOs), reforming the institutions that sustain the rule of law, protecting human rights, creating a 21st century border, and building stronger and more resilient communities, the United States and Mexico will ensure greater prosperity and inclusive economic growth on both sides of the border. To support the President's Global Climate Change (GCC) Initiative, a strong partnership with the Government of Mexico and other stakeholders will promote clean energy adoption, energy efficiency, low carbon development, and sustainable land use and forest management to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Mexico is a global non-proliferation partner and related assistance will focus on enhancing Mexico's capabilities and commitment. Mexico continues to be a strong partner of the initiatives that complement the United States' programs to address the root causes of unlawful migration from Central America.
